subject: Relationships
title: Love Bombing: The Toxic First Impression
description: Learn Love Bombing: The Toxic First Impression in one minute.

hook.text: He sent 50 texts a day, planned elaborate dates, and said 'I love you' after one week. It felt like a fairy tale.

buildup.text: Love bombing is an overwhelming display of attention, affection, and flattery used to gain control quickly.

discovery.text: It floods the brain with dopamine and oxytocin, creating intense attachment before any real trust is built.

twist.text: Love bombing isn't love. It's strategy. Once you're hooked, the attention withdraws â€” and you chase it.

climax.text: Real love builds slowly with consistent care. Love bombing is intensity disguised as intimacy.

punchline.text: Love bombing isn't love. It's a strategy to create dependency fast.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of love bombing?
